alert.note: Alert for Lowndes; Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 1:41AM CST until February 07 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Buttahatchie River near Aberdeen For the Buttahatchie River...including Aberdeen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Buttahatchie River near Aberdeen. * WHEN...Through early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, flood water begins to cover Air Base Road located on the west bank of the river. Low-lying farmland near the river also begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM CST Saturday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 AM CST Saturday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage by Monday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
